Red. o. ansv. utg. av Tidskr. Skogen 41-47 o. Sv. Skogs-v:fören. Tidskr. 43-47. RNO.
translated: Johansson, Folke Ludvig "Hemming", civil forest officer, director, from Gothenburg, born on February 5th, 1899 in Stockholm to director H.J.J. and Olga Sellman. He passed his exams in Stockholm in 1918 and completed the forestry course in the School of Agriculture in 1924. He served as secretary in the Swedish Forestry Association from 1926 to 1940, secretary in the central council for forestry management from 1938 to 1941, was involved with the Swedish Forestry Association from 1940 to 1947, and was the chief of the forestry control bureau from 1941 to 1947. He became the managing director of the Skogsällskapet (Swedish Forest Society) in Gothenburg in 1947. He was the secretary of the 31-year-old Skogsägarkår (Forest Owners Association) in 1931, the forest fire commission in 1935, the 36-year-old forest investigation in 1936, and the Skogsveckan (Forest Week) from 1940 to 1947. In 1942, he was a special adviser for the forestry law investigation, and was a member of the forestry board investigation of 1944. In 1946, he was the chairman of the agricultural committee for Stockholm's county and city, and a member of the board for the State Forestry Masters School in 1944. He was the chairman of the 1946 committee for education of land surveying and agriculture, member of the report and delegate at several international conferences. He was the editor and responsible publisher for the forestry magazines Tidskriften Skogen from 1941 to 1947 and Svenska Skogsvårdsföreningens (Swedish Forestry Association) Tidskrift from 1943 to 1947. He was awarded the RNO award.
